definition: article/commodity/product/goods/kind/grade/rank/character/disposition/nature/temperament/variety/to taste sth/to sample/to criticize/to comment/to judge/to size up/fret (on a guitar or lute)

sentences.english: The internationalization of the food science and technology periodicals is irreversible.
sentences.chinese: 食品类科技期刊国际化是时代发展不可逆转的潮流。

sentences.english: Another food movie worth watching is Super Size Me.
sentences.chinese: 另一部值得观看的食品类影片就是《超码的我》。

sentences.english: The present invention relates to a nutrient health-care product for pregnant woman and its production process.
sentences.chinese: 一种孕妇营养保健品及其生产工艺，涉及食品类。

sentences.english: Foodstuff enterprises are supposed to become ethical and conscientious ones in particular.
sentences.chinese: 特别是食品类企业，最应成为道德良心的企业。

sentences.english: With the iPad tablet, Apple jump-started a product category.
sentences.chinese: 在iPad的助推下，苹果开创了一个新的产品类别。

sentences.english: A category-based algorithm is proposed in this paper to enhance mining association rules.
sentences.chinese: 提出了一种基于品类聚类的关联规则优化算法。

sentences.english: I don't trust them that much on food items.
In the United States, groceries represent only 8 percent of the Consumer Price Index.
sentences.chinese: 在美国，食品类只占消费者价格指数的8%。

sentences.english: If you choose Asian exhibitors, what kinds of products do you need?
sentences.chinese: 如果您选择亚洲展商，您所需要的产品类别为？

sentences.english: Eating foods that don’t come with copious amounts of packaging saves from adding to landfill.
sentences.chinese: 不吃那些品类丰富的包装食品，就更少地增加垃圾。

definition: e-commerce (abbr. for 電子商務|电子商务[dian4 zi3 shang1 wu4])/(old) to negotiate by telegram or telephone
fresh produce and freshly prepared foods
to retail/to sell individually or in small quantities
